item.title: Senior African Peace and Security Architecture (APSA) Specialist (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Identification/Formulation of support to ECOWAS APSA mandate and ECOWAS mechanism to promote and maintain peace, stability and post crisis operations

Overall objective

This assignment will provide a coherent proposal to ECOWAS and EU for the strengthening of coordination and cooperation in security in West Africa within the framework of African Union’s Africa Peace and Security Architecture and the implementation of a project dealing with specific areas as defined in section 1.1.

It will give sufficient background information and justifications to enable the ECOWAS and EU to make an informed decision on specific objectives and of the project’s implementation modalities.

Specific objectives The specific objective of this assignment is to prepare all the necessary elements of an Action Documents to implement a project covering areas A and B.

It is required to proceed to:

  • an identification of issues, strategical orientations and priority intervention areas (Phase I)
  • a formulation of the project under 11th EDF (Phase II).

African Peace and Security Architecture (APSA) Specialist + Identification/Formulation Specialist (Logframe and Technical and Administrative provisions) (Category I)

Education

item.title: Environment Infrastructure Expert (cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Self-evaluation of IPA I Environment Infrastructure Projects

The global objective of the evaluation is to provide the EUD to BiH with sufficient information to make an informed judgment about the past performance of the selected projects (their efficiency, effectiveness and impact), to document lessons learned and to provide practical recommendations for follow-up action.

Specific objectives;

  • To assess in particular the efficiency, effectiveness and impact of project implementation, indicating clearly to what extent the results, purposes and overall objectives of the selected projects were achieved.
  • To provide comparative assessment of efficiency, effectiveness and impact of EUD interventions based on the selected projects, including strengthens and weaknesses of the different implementation methods.
  • To identify and document lessons learned, focusing on the design, implementation and management of the selected projects for improving of programming and identification of possible future actions under IPA II.
  • To provide recommendations for practical follow-up action, with the emphasis on actions related to sustainability of project benefits.

The evaluation will determine to what extent the projects have collectively succeeded in meeting the objectives of the EU as set out in the relevant country strategy paper and to what extent the projects have increased the Government’s ability to meet its objectives within the agreed framework of cooperation with the EU. It is therefore important that the review will focus not only on the individual projects being evaluated, but also on their overall achievements.

Environment Infrastructure Expert (cat. II)

Education

  • As a minimum Master Degree in Engineering disciplines relevant to the fields of this contract, or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience of at least 4 years above the general professional experience duration fixed below.

Experience General profession experience:

  • Minimum 6 years of general professional experience in the environment sector.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in 3 environment infrastructure programmes/projects funded by EU and/or other donors/IFIs.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written;
  • Knowledge of the local language (B/H/S) will be considered an asset.

‘Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service’

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Expert on Social Cash Transfers (cat II)

  • at least 6 years’ experience in a social sector, with some of it related to poverty reduction and/or social transfers
  • a basic degree in a social sector and a Master Degree in a relevant sector, such as social protection, Social Science, economics, poverty related studies, social work, or related relevant studies. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 8 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • proven experience with poverty reduction programmes, and/or social transfer programmes, social welfare problematics, and/or targeting mechanisms for vulnerable groups, benefit delivery mechanisms, monitoring and database maintenance for social programmes,…
  • knowledgeable about conditionalities in welfare programmes, co-responsibilities of beneficiaries, and how to monitor these.
  • proven experience with social cash transfer schemes in developing countries would be an advantage
  • proven experience in working with orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) in developing countries would be an advantage
  • experience in monitoring and/or evaluation of development projects, preferable in a developing country setting, would be an advantage
  • experience with EU methodology and regulations, EU monitoring and reporting practices would be an advantage.
  • computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: SME Development Specialist (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of IPA 2011 Grant Support for Local Economic Development

Global objective: To provide the Delegation of the European Union with systematic and timely evaluation of its programme to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

Specific objective: The specific objective of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform of future choices on IPA II support to Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of SME competitiveness and innovation at local level.

SME Development Specialist (Cat III)

Qualifications and skills

  • Education at least Master Degree in any field related to economic sciences, or in its absence, at least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development are required above the general professional experience required below.

General professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in one international aid project in the area of SME or local economy development completed in the past five years.
  • The expert should preferably demonstrate previous relevant expertise in the country/region.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com
